instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no backlight, computer does get an image backlight is just not present. im getting the 12.5v all the way up to <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> but not after. No short to ground after the transistor .901 in diode mode both <RESISTOR>R7702</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7701</RESISTOR> are reading correct resistance also I am getting 5v on pin 5 of <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Any history?? Check <RESISTOR>R7750</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7751</RESISTOR>, also check pull up resistors...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7750</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7751</RESISTOR> are both good, also which resistors are the pull ups, sorry for being an idiot. computer was liquid damaged, but looks as though someone ultrasoniced it already

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7752</RESISTOR>/3 are both giving me 1.58k ohms and i get .535 in diode mode on both data lines

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Try a known good LCD assembly. The LCD talks to the backlight chip to enable <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>. Assuming you checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: i did check smc lid, 3.4v but i did try to get continuity from the data lines to the lcd connector, and i have an open line and what looks to be destroyed traces, would that cause no backlight

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I2C lines on pins 3 and 4 of LCD connector need to be good for <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> to open, this is communication bus with backlight chip to LCD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: okay yeah theres no continuity so ill have to run a couple wires

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I didnt have any insulated wire left, so i ordered some, just wondering if the caps are important in that line or if i can just run a wire from <RESISTOR>R7752</RESISTOR>/3 directly to pins 3-4 of the lcd connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: If you mean <CAPACITOR>C8358</CAPACITOR>/59 they are not critical. Why not just fix the corroded via near the LCD connector by poking a strand of wire through it. That is the common failure point in these lines.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: oh i didnt realize you could do that. the whole pad where it goes through the board is pretty much gone, just a slight strand is left

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: i got the wires ran, no short to ground on them both to the right pins and have continuity still no backlight, 12.8v still isnt getting through <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> anything else i can check or is the screen toast?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: the sda line stays at 5v constantly but the scl line jumps around like a data line should

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Try a known good LCD assembly first, make sure 2015 model is used!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Display is working now, the scl line had intermittent connection with the pin
